name: Node status
description: This rule checks the node status provided by the Elasticsearch

fields.name: content
fields.value:
1. Check the network connection between your client and Elasticsearch nodes.
 2. Ensure that the Elasticsearch nodes are running and have the required version installed.
 3. Verify that the cluster is healthy by running the command `GET /_cluster/health`.
 4. If the problem persists, check the logs of each Elasticsearch node for any error messages or warnings.
 5. If necessary, restart the affected Elasticsearch node and verify if the issue is resolved.
 6. If the issue still remains unresolved, consider checking the Elasticsearch documentation or contacting their support team for further assistance.

For more information on troubleshooting Elasticsearch issues, you can refer to the official Elasticsearch documentation: <https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/client/java-api/current/index.html>
